title: Truman Signing his Veto to Congress's Tax Reduction Bill
Scopenote: Aboard the presidential yacht Williamsburg, President Harry S. Truman signs a veto to Congress's Tax Reduction Bill.  Looking on are Charles Ross, Presidential Press Secretary (left) and William J. Hopkins, Executive Clerk of the White House (right).  From:  Houston Post.

title: President and Mrs. Truman after President Addresses Joint Session
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right front), Mrs. Bess Truman, and cabinet members leave the Capitol today after the President addressed a Joint Session of the House and Senate.  Left to Right:  Front, Secretary of State George Marshall; Bess Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; and the President.  Back:  Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Attorney General Tom Clark; and Charles Ross, Press Secretary to the President.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman and Daughter Margaret at Washington National Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his daughter, Margaret, at Washington National Airport. Margaret's face is crossed out in this photo, marked up for newspaper use.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman with Brazil's President Dutra
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with Brazil's President Eurico Gaspar Dutra (right) stands at attention on his arrival in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil Monday.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman, Mrs. Truman, and Margaret on the USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess Truman, and daughter Margaret stand on the deck as they watch the return of the USS Missouri's scouting planes September 15 during the presidential trip from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Norfolk, Virginia. Same as 69-325, only this photo is not airbrushed.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Sports an Admiral's Cap While Aboard USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is pleased with himself as he poses in what he calls his "Six-Star Admiral's Cap" aboard the USS Missouri.  The Chief Executive and his party are returning from a state visit to Brazil.  (Same as half of the photo on 92-3).  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Sports Yachting Cap, while Bess Dons Pith Helmet
Scopenote: Aboard the USS Missouri at sea, the President, a land-lubber, is right pleased with himself as he poses in what he calls his six-star Admiral's cap" aboard the USS Missouri.  Mrs. Truman (right) for her part, prefers a tropical pith helmet."  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Rehearses Community Chest Radio Address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses at a microphone today as he rehearses his radio address opening the 1947 Community Chest campaign for funds.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Commission Reorganizes Executive Branch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated center) is flanked by members of a 12-man commission engaged in a study to increase the efficiency of the Executive Branch of the government.  Front, L to R:  George H. Mead, Dayton, Ohio; former President Herbert Hoover; President Truman; Joseph P. Kennedy; and Senator John J. McClellan (D-Arkansas). Rear, L to R:  Representative Clarence J. Brown (R-O); Secretary of Defense James V. Forrestal; Arthur S. Flemming, Civil Service Commission; Secretary of State Dean Acheson; James Rowe; and Representative Carter Manasco (D-Alabama).  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman with Citizens' Food Committee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) studies national food savings plan as he is surrounded by advisors at Citizens Food Committee meeting at White House today.  Left to Right:  Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson; Secretary of Commerce W. Averell Harriman; Acting Secretary of State Robert Lovett; and Charles Luckman, Citizens Committee Chairman.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Operates Movie Camera
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman operates a movie camera during a picture-taking session on the south grounds of the White House today. The subjects were members of the White House News Photographers Association (the "One More Club"), who presented a movie and still camera to the Chief Executive during a brief ceremony. From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Learns Conducting Technique from National Symphony Conductor
Scopenote: Hans Kindler (right), Director of the National Symphony Orchestra, demonstrates baton technique to President Harry S. Truman tonight before the opening concert of the symphony at Constitution Hall, attended by the President and his party.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Delivering Address on Inflation and Totalitarianism
Scopenote: President Truman stands at a rostrum bearing the seal of the Presidency of the United States, just before he delivered a message to the nation from the White House tonight.  He called for "prompt and courageous action" to stop inflation at home and to protect France and Italy against "totalitarian pressures."  From:  Houston Post

title: President Truman Receives 10-gallon Hat from Texan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tries on a "lucky" ten gallon hat presented to him at the White House by John Ben Shepperd (right) of Texas, President of the U.S. Junior Chamber of Commerce.  The donor said the hat had been rubbed with the left hind foot of a Texas jackrabbit.  Photo is airbrushed.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Cautions Joint Session Against Inflation
Scopenote: Three-in-one photo of President Harry S. Truman, who speaks with emphasis (left), purses his lips (center), and drinks from a glass of water (right) as he addresses a Joint Session of the Senate and House.  Asking for powers to fight inflation he cautioned:  "If we fail to prepare and disaster results, we shall have gambled with our national safety and lost."  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Addresses Congress About Inflation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks today before a Joint Session of Congress, delivering a 10-minute anti-inflation program of what he called "drastic measures."  The President asked for limited price and wage controls and rationing authority to stave off inflation at home while helping friendly countries.   From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Attends Luncheon Honoring Democratic National Committee Chair
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends a luncheon in honor of Senator J. Howard McGrath (D-RI), new chairman of the Democratic National Committee, in a Senate dining room at the Capital today.  Left to Right:  Senator McGrath; President Truman; Senator Theodore Green (D-RI), the luncheon host; and Senator Alben W. Barkley (D-KY), Senate Minority Leader.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Strolling the Beach at Key West
Scopenote: Wearing an old hat and a sport shirt with the tails worn outside his pants, President Harry S. Truman takes a stroll along the beach at Key West, Florida, where he is enjoying a vacation in the sunshine.  In the background is Fort Taylor, which was used during the Civil War.  Today, Mr. Truman was scheduled to dedicate the 450,000-acre Everglades National Park.  His dedicatory address will be broadcast over the nation.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Visits with Light Plane Pilots
Scopenote: Clifford Evans (left) of Washington and George Truman (right) of Los Angeles today show President Harry S. Truman "short snorter" bills they collected during a leisurely around-the-world flight in light planes.  The pilots received the President's congratulations during a brief visit to the White House.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Close-up Photo of President Truman
Scopenote: Close-up of President Harry S. Truman, smiling.  From: Houston Post.

title: Oval Office Photo of President Harry S. Truman, Pen in Hand
Scopenote: Portrait of President Harry S. Truman at his Oval Office desk, pen in hand.  Same as 69-1198, but not cropped as much.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Traveling By Train, Truman Talks to Russian Ambassador
Scopenote: Enroute to Bonham, Texas on President Harry S. Truman's special train, President Truman (left) talks with Walter Bedell Smith, Russian Ambassador, after Smith boarded the train in Dallas.  From: Houston Post.

title: Truman at Podium at Unidentified Event
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking, with flags in background.  The place and event are not identified.  From: Houston Post.

title: The Truman Family at a Constitution Hall Reception
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Bess Truman listen as daughter Margaret (left) appears to be going over a selection at the Constitution Hall Reception Room tonight, at which the President had requested pianist Jose Iturbi play at the latter's recital.  The Truman's met Iturbi prior to the program, the President requesting a Chopin waltz, A flat Opus 62.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman with Pianist Jose Iturbi
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman strums imaginary keys at Constitution Hall tonight as he describes a Chopin waltz, A flat Opus 62, he would like for pianist Jose Iturbi (left) to play during the latter's recital.  Watching are Drucie Snyder, daughter of Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Margaret Truman; and First Lady Bess Truman.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Family as They Leave to Attend State of Union Address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess Truman (left), and their daughter, Margaret, stand beside a car upon leaving the south entrance of the White House today to ride to the Capitol for the President's address on the State of the Union before a Joint Session of Congress.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Strolls Through the Rose Garden
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, bareheaded, walks through the White House Rose Garden today in the sunshine that accompanied a rise in temperature to 60 degrees in mid-afternoon. The south portico of the White House is in the background. From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Greets Paralysis "Poster Boy"
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stops to take Terry Tullos, three-year-old Laurel, Mississippi infantile paralysis victim, in his arms today as the boy with braces on his legs walks up the Chief Executive.  Terry has been selected as "poster boy" for this year's March of Dimes campaign to raise funds for treatment of infantile paralysis.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman's Presidential Portrait Painted by Greta Kempton of New York
Scopenote: A Democratic National Committee official said yesterday that between 20,000 and 25,000 copies of this portrait of President Harry S. Truman have been ordered for use in connection with Jefferson-Jackson Day party dinners.  The portrait was done last spring by Greta Kempton, New York artist.  From:  Houston Press.

title: Mrs. Truman and Margaret Attend a Masked Ball in New Orleans
Scopenote: Escorted by two masked members of the Krewe of Moslem, First Lady Bess Truman and Margaret Truman walk across the ballroom floor at the Ball of Moslem held in New Orleans.  The two Air Force officers in the background acted as escorts and were also featured in the Ball, which depicted wings and birds.  From Houston Post.

title: A Rancher and His Mare Visit Truman at White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman today stands bareheaded as he inspects "Honey," a mare which Ned Kennedy rode up the White House driveway when he called on the Chief Executive.  Kennedy, who operates a ranch near Tacoma, Washington, and a companion crossed the country on horseback.  From: Houston Post.

title: Truman Chatting Before Opening of a Conference of Women Leaders
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) poses with Secretary of Labor Lewis B. Schwellenbach (left) and Frieda Miller, Director of the Women's Bureau of the Department of Labor, today at the opening of a conference of women leaders. The meeting commemorates the 100th anniversary of the movement for women's rights. From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Accepts Citation from National Conference of Christians and Jews
Scopenote: A smiling President Harry S. Truman (center) today displays an emblem and a citation which he received from the National Conference of Christians and Jews.  The President stands on the White House steps with Thomas E. Braniff (left), Robert Patterson (right) and other officers of the conference.  Man partly hidden at extreme right is J. Robert Rubin.  The citation says Truman holds "moral principle to be above all other considerations."  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman with daughter Margaret and Senator McGrath at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Senator J. Howard McGrath (D-RI) (center), National Democratic Chairman, listens as President Harry S. Truman and daughter Margaret chat at the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Acknowledges Ovation at Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner Address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, smiling broadly, waves in response to an ovation just before he began his Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner Address at the Mayflower Hotel tonight. Senator Alben Barkley (D-KY) (right) applauds. Wilson W. Wyatt (rear, left of the President) was Chairman of the dinner committee. From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman and Margaret at a Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) turns to talk with daughter Margaret tonight as the Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner got underway at the Statler Hotel in Washington, D. C.  Wilson W. Wyatt (right) is chairman of the dinner committee.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Leaves Washington for a Caribbean Vacation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman left Washington by air today for a Caribbean vacation.  Mr. Truman, en route to Key West, Florida, on the first lap of a 2-week trip which includes inspection of the nation's Caribbean outposts, took off from Washington National Airport in the Presidential airplane "Sacred Cow."  Left to Right:  unidentified soldier; Lieutenant Colonel Henry Myers, recently retired Presidential pilot; President Truman; and Presidential pilot Lieutenant Colonel Francis W. Williams.  From:  Houston Post

title: President Truman Leaves Airport for Key West Naval Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrived here aboard the "Sacred Cow."  He is shown as he left the airport for the naval base.  L to R:  Captain Cecil Adell, Commander of the Key West Base, President Truman, and Admiral William D. Leahy.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Disembarks from his Plane "Sacred Cow" in Boca Chica
Scopenote: President Truman waves a greeting to friends upon his arrival here today in Boca Chica, Florida.  He flew from Washington in his plane the "Sacred Cow."

title: Truman, Accompanied by Governor of Puerto Rico, Waves from Automobile
Scopenote: Greeted at the Isla Grande airport by the Governor of Puerto Rico, Jesus T. Pinero (right), President Harry S. Truman waves to the crowd on his way to the hotel.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Boarding "Sacred Cow" as he Travels to San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaves for San Juan, Puerto Rico.  He is boarding his plane "The Scared Cow."  From:  Houston Post.

title: Governor of Virgin Islands Welcomes President Truman
Scopenote: President Truman is welcomed to St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, by the Governor of the Islands, William H. Hastie (right).  The Presidential yacht, "Williamsburg," is in the background.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Studies a Commemorative Plaque with Governor of Virgin Islands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with the Governor of the Virgin Islands, William H. Hastie (left), looking at a plaque honoring Truman and commemorating the 100th anniversary of the abolition of slavery.  The plaque was on the bandstand of Emancipation Park, Charlotte Amalie, Virgin Islands.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Waves with his Panama Hat Upon Return from Caribbean Vacation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman flashes a bright smile and waves his Panama hat after his arrival at Key West from his Caribbean cruise.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Signs Civil Service Retirement Bill (Key West)
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing the Civil Service Retirement Bill at the Little White House at Key West, Florida submarine base.  See also 92-49.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Signs Civil Service Retirement Bill at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signing the Civil Service Retirement Bill at the Little White House at Key West, Florida.  See also 92-48.  From:  Houston Post.

title: While in Key West, Truman Delivers Red Cross Address
Scopenote: In a prepared radio address from Key West submarine base, President Harry S. Truman asks the American people to give their "whole-hearted support" to the Red Cross drive.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Poses with Mrs. Truman and Margaret Upon Returning from Key West
Scopenote: Upon arrival at Washington after a fourteen-day trip to Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Cuba, and Key West, Florida, President Harry S. Truman clasps the arms of Margaret (left) and Bess (right).    From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Presents Clapper Memorial Award
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the annual $500 Clapper Memorial Award for outstanding Washington reporting to Nat Finney, correspondent for Minneapolis Star and Tribune and Des Moines Register, at the 25th annual dinner of the White House Correspondents Association.  Also in photo is Earnest B. Vaccaro (left) and Felix Belair, Jr. (right).  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Signs Document Which Allows Cargo Transfer to Italy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman signs an executive order providing for the transfer of 29 passenger and cargo vessels to Italy.  Onlookers are, left to right:  Secretary of State, George Marshall; Admiral Louis E. Denfeld, Chief of Naval Operations; Attorney General Tom Clark; and Italian Ambassador Alberto Tarchiani.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Leaving White House with Secretary of State Marshall and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman talks with Secretary of State George Marshall (left) and Secretary of Defense James Forrestal (right) as they leave the White House.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman with Leaders as he Signs Foreign Aid Bill
Scopenote: At the White House, President Harry S. Truman signs the Foreign Aid Bill.  Looking on from left to right are Senator Arthur Vandenberg, Secretary of Interior Julius Krug, House Speaker Joseph W. Martin, Representative Sol Bloom, and (partially hidden at right) Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Signs Foreign Aid Bill
Scopenote: Wearing a big grin, President Harry S. Truman reaches for the inkwell with one of his pens that he used to sign the Foreign Aid Bill.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Head and Shoulder Photo of Grinning President Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman broadly smiles for the press on his third anniversary of his presidency.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Truman Receives Cowboy Boots from Texas Chamber of Commerce
Scopenote: At the White House, a representative of El Paso, Texas's Chamber of Commerce presented Truman with a pair of Tony Lama cowboy boots.  Representative George H. Mahon (D-TX) shows Truman how to manipulate the hooks for the boots - "El Presidente" style.  Representative Wingate H. Lucas (D-TX) in background.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Presenting Collier Congressional Awards
Scopenote: At the White House, President Harry S. Truman presents the 1948 Collier's Magazine Congressional Awards to Senator Arthur Vandenberg (R-MI) (left) and Speaker Sam Rayburn (D-TX) (right).    Photo has been air-brushed.  From: Houston Press.

title: Truman Displays Gift of Horse Statue on 64th Birthday
Scopenote: On his 64th birthday, President Harry S. Truman displays a miniature horse sent to him by George Totes of Douglas, Wyoming.  George is nine years old.  A photo of Margaret Truman is in the background, in the Oval Office setting.  From:  Houston Post.

title: Presidential Train Trip Continues West, as Truman Poses with Family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing in front of the Presidential train at Omaha, Nebraska with First Lady Bess Truman (right) and Margaret Truman (left).  The tour is to continue westward across the nation.  From: Houston Post.

title: While in Indianapolis, Truman shakes hands with friend, Former Senator Jackson
Scopenote: Greeting an old friend, President Harry S.  Truman shakes hands with former Senator Samuel D. Jackson (left), Chairman of the 1944 Democratic Convention.  They are in Indianapolis, Indiana.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman and Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt Visit in Oval Office
Scopenote: July 1, 1948. With President Harry S. Truman's announcement today that Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt will be acceptable to him as a vice-presidential candidate on the Democratic ticket in November, and his prediction of his own nomination for the presidency on the first ballot at the Democratic Convention in Philadelphia two weeks hence; the pictured duo - President Truman and Mrs. Roosevelt - may well be the Democratic slate in November.  Photo of President Truman and Mrs. Roosevelt was taken 2/27/46 when Mrs. Roosevelt visited the President in the oval office to report on the UNO Conference in London.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman in Cincinnati after Dedicating a Monument in Bolivar, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds a newspaper containing a story of General Eisenhower's refusal to accept Democratic urge that he take the party's Presidential nomination, and issued a terse "no comment" as he stood on the observation platform of his private car this morning.  President Truman stopped here in Cincinnati, Ohio for 30 minutes enroute to Washington from Bolivar, Missouri, where he dedicated a monument.  From: Houston Post.

title: Close-up Photo of President Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman appeared to be a cinch to get the Democratic Presidential nomination.  Democratic Convention speculation centered on who would be his vice-presidential running mate.  This close-up photo of a grinning President Truman was made at the White House.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman and Family Leave by Train for Philadelphia and the Democratic Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess Truman, and daughter Margaret (left) wave from the back platform of their train tonight just before leaving for Philadelphia. Mr. Truman and his party will drive direct from the station there to Convention Hall.  Same as 68-1949, only this is a better print.  From: Houston Post.

title: Kentucky Senator Barkley Addresses Democratic Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) leads applause for Senator Alben Barkley as the veteran Kentucky Senator stands at the speaker's stand to address the Democratic Convention which nominated him for the vice-presidency.  Others applauding are J. Howard McGrath, center, national Democratic chairman, and Representative Sam Rayburn.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Waits to be Introduced at the Democratic Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Senator Alben Barkley sit behind the speaker's stand, waiting to be introduced, just before they spoke to the Democratic Convention tonight.  From: Houston Post.

title: Three Part Photo of President Truman in Acceptance Speech at Democratic Convention
Scopenote: Here are three serious studies of President Harry S. Truman as he assailed Republican policies in his acceptance speech at the Democratic convention in Philadelphia.  From: Houston Post.

title: Truman Delivers Acceptance Speech at Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Both arms dramatically raised, mouth wide open, President Harry S. Truman blasts the G.O.P. as he delivers his acceptance speech before Democratic National Convention delegates in Philadelphia. From: Houston Post.

title: Truman and Barkley Pose With Families at Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Smiling President Harry S. Truman and Senator Alben Barkley appear before delegates of the Democratic National Convention with members of their families.  Left to Right:  Mrs. Bess Truman, President Truman, Mrs. Max Truitt (Marian Frances), daughter of Senator Barkley, Senator Barkley, and Margaret Truman.  From: Houston Post.

title: Truman Family Wave as They Conclude Democratic Convention
Scopenote: It's just the beginning for this trio as they wave to cheering delegates at the marathon closing session of the Democratic Party's 1948 conclave.  They'll be doing it often during the upcoming Presidential campaign.  Left to Right:  First Lady Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and Mrs. Max Truitt, daughter of Senator Alben Barkley.  Photo is slightly touched up.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Receives Season Pass to 1948 National Football League Games from Commissioner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) today receives from Bert Bell (center), National Football League Commissioner, a season pass to the League's 1948 games. George Marshall (right), president of the Washington team in the professional circuit, beams his approval. They are in the Oval Office. From: Houston Post.

title: President Addresses Joint Session of Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, speaking before a Joint Session of Congress today, demands limited price control and an excess of profits tax to help check the rising cost of living.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Addresses Congress's Special Session
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents his program before the special session of Congress today. Seated in front of flag, at left, are Senate President Pro Tempore Arthur H. Vandenberg (left) and House Speaker Joseph W. Martin. A portion of the President's audience, which included cabinet members, members of the diplomatic corps, and of both houses of congress, is in foreground. From: Houston Post.

title: Truman Addresses Rising Cost of Living as he Speaks Before Joint Session of Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, speaking before a Joint Session of Congress today, demands limited price control and an excess of profits tax to help check the rising cost of living.  From: Houston Post.

title: Three View of President Truman as he Addresses Congress
Scopenote: These were the facial expressions of President Harry S. Truman (3 photos) as he placed before Congress an eight-point program.  From: Houston Post.

title: Plane Squadron in Background, as Truman Delivers Dedication Speech at Idlewild Airport
Scopenote: A squadron of planes roars overhead as President Harry S. Truman delivers his speech at the dedication of the 5,000 acre international airport at Idlewild.  While the nation's greatest display of peacetime air power was going on, President Truman declared America was determined to remain strong in the cause of peace.  From: Houston Post.

title: The Truman's Arrive in Independence
Scopenote: After helping his wife from the car which brought them from the airport in Kansas City, Kansas, President Harry S. Truman smilingly turns to greet crowds of fellow townsmen while Mrs. Bess Truman turns to go up to their summer home here in Independence, Missouri.  The President arrived by plane tonight from Washington to vote in Thursday's primary election.  From: Houston Post.

title: Truman Arriving By Car for Airport Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves from his car upon his arrival this afternoon for the Idlewild Airport dedication in New York City. At right is New York's mayor, William O'Dwyer.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman, Walking In Independence, Greets Unidentified Woman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles and tips his hat in a "good morning" greeting to an unidentified woman, and waves as she passes him on a mile long walk here in Independence, Missouri.  A secret service man walks beside the Chief Executive.  From Houston Post.

title: President Truman and Vice-Presidential Candidate Meet at White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), Democratic candidate to succeed himself, listens to Alben W. Barkley, Democratic Senator from Kentucky and Vice-Presidential candidate, as they sit in the President's White House office today at a meeting of the Truman-Barkley Club. (See also 92-89 and 97-1539.)  From Houston Post.

title: President Truman Greets Family of New Secretary of Labor
Scopenote: President Truman greets members of the family of his new Secretary of Labor, Maurice J. Tobin of Boston, at the White House.  L to R:  Carol Ann, 13; Mrs. Tobin; Maurice, Jr., 10 (front); Tobin; Truman; and Helen Louise, 15.  The former Massachusetts mayor was sworn in as successor to the late Lewis Schwellenbach earlier in the day.  From: Houston Post.

title: The President Leaves Yorktown for a Nine-Day Cruise Aboard "Williamsburg"
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles today aboard the yacht Williamsburg just before it left Yorktown.  The President, with a new coat of tan, headed for home on the last leg of his nine-day cruise.  From: Houston Post.

title: Mrs. Truman Poses with New Niece at Child's Baptism
Scopenote: Denver, Colorado.  Mrs. Harry S. Truman is shown with her new niece, Charlotte Margaret (Margo) Wallace at the infant's baptism in St. John the Evangelist Church here.  The President's wife was honorary godmother, though a non-Catholic.  Charlotte Margaret is the daughter of Fred Wallace, Mrs. Truman's brother.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Speaks in Cadillac Square, Detroit, Distance View
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking in Cadillac Square in Detroit, Michigan on Labor Day.  Distance view, Truman from back, crowd shot.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Harry S. Truman Displays Necktie Presented by Denver Teenagers
Scopenote: A fancy maroon necktie was presented to President Harry S. Truman by three Denver junior high school students during President Truman's visit to Denver today.  Then they vanished in the crowd before a photographer could get their picture.  The trio -- Robert Stark, 14; his sister Shirley, 12; and Bessie Chance, 14 -- told a reporter they bought the tie this morning.  From: Houston Post.

title: On Train, Truman Writes Los Angeles Speech
Scopenote: While his train rolls through California today, President Harry S. Truman writes the speech he will deliver tonight in Los Angeles.  He is seated at the dining table in his private car.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Poses Beside Liberty Bell During His Philadelphia Visit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman as he visited one of the nation's shrines, the Liberty Bell in Philadelphia. The President's first stop after his arrival here was at Independence Hall. Same as 68-1575, but more cropped and sharper. From: Houston Post.

title: President and Mrs. Truman Wave From Campaign Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) waves from the rear platform of his special train as he leaves Washington, D. C. this morning for a swing through Maryland and Pennsylvania, Delaware and New York for a series of campaign appearances.  Mrs. Bess Truman stands beside him.  Same as 69-445, but without tough-up marks.  However, this photo does have a mark on Mrs. Truman's face that is not in 69-445.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Places Wreath at Lincoln's Tomb in Springfield, Illinois
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman carried his presidential campaign to the Illinois State Capitol when he spoke in Springfield Monday.  The Chief Executive is pictured as he placed a floral wreath on the tomb of Abraham Lincoln at the Oak Ridge Cemetery in Springfield.  From:  Houston Post.

title: As Presidential Train Returns to Capital, Truman Discusses Defense Budget With Press
Scopenote: At an unusual news conference aboard his campaign train today, President Harry S. Truman announces a slight easing of world tension and a defense budget for next year.  The conference was held just before the train pulled into the Capital.  Same as 70-535, but better print.  From: Houston Post.

title: On a Whistle Stop Tour, Truman Inspects Wilkes-Barre Marines
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman inspects Marines in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania today during one of his whistlestops in the vicinity.  From: Houston Post.

title: Truman Displays Pair of Shoes Presented to Him in Brockton, Massachusetts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds up one of the shoes of two pairs presented to him at Brockton, Massachusetts, just before he made his speech on arrival there.  Brockton is famous for its production of shoes.  From: Houston Post.

title: During Presidential Campaign in New York, Truman Visits With Former National Democratic Chairman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and former national Democratic Chairman James Farley exchange some informal political views on the platform of Lost Battalion Hall, Queens, where the President made his next to the last political talk in the metropolitan area before entraining from Grand Central Station for Independence, Missouri, where he will cast his vote next Tuesday.  The President spent two whirlwind days in his windup of his campaign for election.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Presented Life Membership With Kansas City Shriners
Scopenote: Joseph H. Gunther (left), Commander of the Legion of Honor of the Ararat Temple, presents a life membership in the Legion of Honor to President Harry S. Truman (right) in a ceremony here in Kansas City, Missouri.  At center is Frank Land, Imperial Second Ceremonial Member of the Shrine and founder of the Order of DeMolay.  Same as 68-1579, but better print.  Also, 68-1579 is reversed.  From: Houston Post.

title: Bess, Harry and Margaret Truman at Jackson County Courthouse
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, his wife Bess and his daughter Margaret, are photographed as they arrived at the Jackson County Courthouse in  Independence, Missouri tonight for a Victory Rally staged by their fellow townsmen of Independence. President Truman has been elected President.  Same as 65-765, only better print.  From: Houston Post.

title: Truman Greets Crowd Outside Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City Upon Presidential Victory
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman wears a broad grin and raises his hands over his head as he greets a crowd outside Hotel Muehlebach in Kansas City, Missouri after Gov. Thomas Dewey had conceded victory in the Presidential election.  Same as 78-696, only better print and less cropped.  Photo 78-696 is credited to Photo World.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman, Bess and Margaret arrive at Jackson County Courthouse
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, his wife Bess and his daughter Margaret, are photographed as they arrived at Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri tonight for a victory Rally staged by their fellow townsmen of Independence.  President Truman has just won the presidential election.  Same as 65-765, only better print  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman and Vice-President Barkley Raise Hands After Winning Election
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Vice-President Alben Barkley raised their clasped hands in a victory gesture as they meet at Union Station in Washington, D. C. Senator J. Howard McGrath, Democratic National Chairman, is in center background. From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Stands in Car in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands in his car before the start of a parage in Key West, Florida, to acknowledge the ovation of the citizens.  President Truman flew from Washington, D. C., with a stop at Hew Bern, North Carolina.  Same as 70-1140, only much better photo.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Greets Senator Barkley and Leslie Biffle in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greeted Senator Alben Barkley (left) and Leslie Biffle (right), Secretary of the Democratic Policy Committee, upon their arrival in Key West, Florida today.  They have their arms raised in a victory gesture.  President Truman and Senator Barkley have just won the presidential election.  Same as 69-388, only much better photo.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Waves from Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves from the Blair House after returning here to Washington today from Florida where he spent two weeks.  The President and his family will live in Blair House while repairs are being made on the White House.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman and Family Arrived at Washington, D.C. Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his wife, Bess, and daughter Margaret arrive after spending two weeks in Florida.  They are standing on the ramp of the airplane Independence at Washington National Airport.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Chief Justice Vinson on Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) accompanied by Chief Justice Fred Vinson, waves from his special train today upon his departure for Philadelphia to see the Army-Navy Football game.  From; Houston Post.

title: President Truman Discussing Western European Affairs with Marshall, Hoffman and Harriman
Scopenote: Left to right:  President Harry S. Truman; Secretary of State George C. Marshall; Paul G. Hoffman, Economic Cooperation Administrator; and W. Averell Harriman, Economic Cooperation Administration Roving Ambassador, discuss western European affairs and the Marshall Plan at a conference in the President's office today.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Harry S. Truman meets with Arkansas officials
Scopenote: President Truman shakes hands with Governor-elect Sidney McMath of Arkansas and Leslie L. Biffle, a native of Arkansas, when the President and other officials dropped in on the Arkansas Society State Meeting today in Washington, D.C. Left to Right; John Steelman, Assistant to the President; President Harry S. Truman; John Snyder, Secretary of the Treasury; Governor-elect McMath; and Leslie L. Biffle, slated to become the Secretary of the Senate. From: Houston Post.

title: Head and Shoulder Photo of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses for a new portrait after completing today's work in his White House office.  He leaves tomorrow to spend Christmas at his home in Independence, Missouri.  From: Houston Post.

title: President Truman Stands Outside the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles as he stands (full-length) outside the White House today as he leaves for the Capitol to deliver his State of the Union address before a Joint Session of Congress.  Same as 69-656, only much better print.  From: Houston Post.

title: Mrs. Truman and Margaret arrive at Capitol to hear State of the Union Speech
Scopenote: Mrs. Bess Truman (left) and daughter Margaret Truman arrive at the Capitol today to hear the President's State of the Union message to Congress.  Mrs. Truman wore a black outfit with a fur jacket and a hat trimmed in white.  Margaret work a black cloth coat, a fur stole, and a black hat with a long tan feather.  Same as 68-1248, but much better print.  From:  Houston Post.

title: President Truman Receives a Golden Horseshoe
Scopenote: President Truman receives from Sen. Scott Lucas (D-IL) a gold horseshoe from the Phoenix Horseshoe Company of Joliet, Illinois, during a White House ceremony today. From: Houston Post.

title: Truman prepares to speak at Civil Air Patrol banquet
Scopenote: President Truman unfolds his speech as he prepares to address the Civil Air Patrol banquet attendees in Washington, D. C..  He said that we are winning the Cold War, but expressed great fear that the United States may lose it if Congress continues its efforts to cut the administration's defense and foreign aid programs.  Donor:  Houston Post

title: Side by Side Photographs of President Truman and Alben Barkley
Scopenote: Side by side photographs of President Harry S. Truman and Senator Alben Barkley, who ran at Vice President in 1948.  These photos were obviously not taken at the same time, and are slightly touched up.  From: Houston Post.
